com.vector.cfg.automation.scripting.base

Interface IScriptExecutionContext

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IDynamicObjectAware
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IApplicationScriptExecutionContext, IProjectScriptExecutionContext, IScriptCreationApi.IScriptExecutionContextWithNotExecutableReasons

    @DynamicTarget(value={"com.vector.cfg.automation.api.project.IProjectHandlingApiEntryPoint","com.vector.cfg.automation.api.userinteraction.IUserInteractionApiEntryPoint","com.vector.cfg.workflow.groovy.parse.IWorkflowApiEntryPoint","com.vector.cfg.gen.core.bswmdmodel.groovy.api.IBswmdModelDefRefApiEntryPoint"})
 @PublishedApi(value=ADDITIONS_ALLOWED)
 @PublishedApiDomain(value=AUTOMATION_IF)
public interface IScriptExecutionContext
extends IDynamicObjectAware
    IScriptExecutionContext class represents one IScriptTask execution of the client code.
    Every IScriptTask could be be executed, and retrieve passed arguments and other context information. This execution information of a script task is tracked by the IScriptExecutionContext.

    The IScriptExecutionContext holds the context of the execution:

    • The script task arguments
    • The current running script task
    • The current active script logger
    • The active project, if existing
    • The script temp folder
    • The script task user defined arguments

    The IScriptExecutionContext is also the entry point into every automation API, and provide access to the different API classes. The classes are describes in their own chapters like IProjectHandlingApiEntryPoint or IWorkflowApiEntryPoint.

    The context is immediately active, when the code block of an IScriptTask is called.

    Groovy Code
    The client sample illustrates the seamless usage of the IScriptExecutionContext class in Groovy: 
     
 scriptTask("taskName"){
   code{  // The IScriptExecutionContext is automatically active here
      // Call methods of the IScriptExecutionContext
      def logger = scriptLogger
      def temp = paths.tempFolder

      // Use an automation API
      workflow{
          // Now the Workflow API is active
      }
   }
 }
    In Groovy the IScriptExecutionContext is automatically activated inside of the code{} block.
    Java Code
    For java clients the method getInstance(Class) provides access to the API classes, which are seamlessly available for the groovy clients: 
     
 // Java code
 // Passed from the script task:
 IScriptExecutionContext scriptContext = ...;

 // Retrieve automation API in Java
 IWorkflowApi workflow = scriptContext.getInstance(IWorkflowApiEntryPoint.class).getWorkflow();
 IWorkflowContext workflowCtx = workflow.getWorkflow();


 // In groovy code it would be:
 workflow{

 }
    In Java code the context is always the first parameter passed to every task code (see IScriptTaskCode).

    Code Block Arguments

    The code block can have arguments passed into the script task execution. The arguments passed into the code{ } block are defined by the IScriptTaskType of the script task. 
     
 scriptTask("Task"){
   code{ arg1, arg2, ... -> // arguments here defined by the IScriptTaskType

   }
 }

 scriptTask("Task2"){
   // Or you could specify the type of the arguments for code completion
   code{ String arg1, List arg2 ->
   }
 }

    The arguments can also retrieved with getScriptTaskArguments().

    For each IScriptTask execution a new IScriptExecutionContext is created.

    To retrieve the IScriptExecutionContext of the currently running thread, see class ScriptExecutionContexts.

    All method parameters and return values must be non-null unless documented otherwise.

    (c) Copyright Vctr Informatik GmbH. All Rights Reserved.

    See Also:
    ScriptExecutionContexts, IScriptTask

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        @PublishedMethod
<T> T getInstance(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Returns the requested service instance by the passed Class.

        Normally this method is used to retrieve automation API instance from Java code clients, where these instance are not available like in Groovy.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the instance to retrieve
        Parameters:
        type - the class of the requested instance.
        Returns:
        service instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if the argument is null
        com.google.inject.ConfigurationException - if this IServiceContext cannot find or create the provider.
        com.google.inject.ProvisionException - if there was a runtime failure while providing an instance.

      • getPaths

        @PublishedMethod
IAutomationPathsApi getPaths()
        Returns the paths API to retrieve and resolve Path objects.

        Possible paths are:

        • Script folder
        • Temp folder
        • SIP folder
        • Project folder
        Returns:
        the paths API
        See Also:
        IAutomationPathsApi

      • getScriptContext

        @PublishedMethod
IScriptExecutionContext getScriptContext()
        Return this instance.

        This could be used the get the IScriptExecutionContext, when it is only a delegate of a Closure in Groovy code.

        Returns:
        the script context

      • getScriptLogger

        @PublishedMethod
ILogger getScriptLogger()
        Returns the script logger of the IScript, see IScript.getScriptLogger().
        The script task execution (IScriptExecutionContext) provides a script logger to log events during an execution. The method getScriptLogger() returns the logger. The logger can be used to log:
        • Errors
        • Warnings
        • Debug messages
        • More...

        You shall always prefer the usage of the logger before using the println() of stdout or stderr.

        In any code block without direct access to the script API, you can write the following code to access the logger: ScriptApi.scriptLogger

        The ILogger also provides a formatting syntax for the format String. The syntax is {IndexNumber} and the index of arguments after the format String.

        It is also possible to use the Groovy GString syntax for formatting.

        Returns:
        the script logger

      • getScriptTask

        @PublishedMethod
IScriptTask getScriptTask()
        Returns the currently running IScriptTask.
        Returns:
        the currently running script task

      • getScriptTaskArguments

        @PublishedMethod
java.util.List<java.lang.Object> getScriptTaskArguments()
        Returns the list of arguments passed to the IScriptTask code during execution ( see IScriptTaskCode).

        The types of the arguments is defined in the IScriptTaskType of the currently running task.

        Returns:
        the script task arguments

      • getScriptTaskExecutionThread

        @PublishedMethod
java.lang.Thread getScriptTaskExecutionThread()
        Returns the Thread, on which the IScriptTask was called.
        Returns:
        the script task execution thread

      • getScriptTempFolder

        @PublishedMethod
java.nio.file.Path getScriptTempFolder()
        Returns a temporary created file system folder for this running IScriptTask.

        The Path is absolute and the folder exists.

        The folder is created at the first invocation, and will return the same folder for subsequent calls. For a new execution a new folder is returned.

        Returns:
        the script temp folder
